summary: This bill, the Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2025, directs the Secretary of Labor to establish an occupational safety and health standard to protect workers from heat-related injuries and illnesses. It mandates employers provide safe workplaces, outlines worker heat protection standards (including engineering, administrative, and personal protective equipment controls), and specifies requirements for water, rest breaks, acclimatization, training, and language access. The bill includes rulemaking procedures, enforcement mechanisms, whistleblower protections, and recordkeeping/reporting guidelines. It also authorizes appropriations for implementation.
